intro: Leeuwenbergia letestui, commonly known as the Cape bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces showy blooms in spring and summer, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. The leaves are strap-like and evergreen, adding visual interest throughout the year.
